text: Hey I just remembered another thing Mark mentioned on that last call. He didn't like how the topic filter button was text and thought it should be an icon like the rest of the buttons. I have my own opinions on that but want to know if any of you think that's something worth implementing.
what are your own opinions?
you go first trent and then I'll weigh in with my thoughts

The complaint was, again, centered on inconsistency, which I don't think in this case is a real issue. If we're going for clarity, we're going to run into the age-old debate over how clear an actual icon will be, and one for "filter topic" no less. I can find a ton of examples of widely used social networking sites that have buttons with text and buttons with icons in the same composition, so I don't think it's a real issue.

I admit, I don't recall him pointing filter out as one of the things to icon-up. Knew he was poking at home/reading list, but don't recall the filter as part of that. Agree with you that filter icon is going to be difficult to pull off with clarity. 

My recollection of that filter topic was simply the break into content that he wasn't feeling. Me personally, I think we NEED some sort of clear break that says — You're currently viewing this topic. I thought that, especially when it is on large screen, it worked well as is.
I do remember him bring up an icon
hmm. Clearly we need an official note taker in our meetings
and I agree - I think this is a pretty clear case of clarity vs consistency. My feeling i that in this case, we don't gain a lot with an icon
Personally, I don't think it is worth doing
agreed - I suppose pending our testing this afternoon
right
which, given the number of people invited to that (i didn't see that until today) — I think we need a relatively tight structure for today
yeah - I'd actually like to go one by one if we can
Yeah, half an hour is not enough for all 8 or 9 people to participate
I think it wont take more than a couple minutes each
but I think we'll know what we need after 3-4 folks
agreed
on both of those topics
we have Robbie and Melissa on board
if we can get abby or mary I think we'll be good to go
i can cut down on the invite
i invited all of those knowing not all attend
maybe we just go with those 4 (robbie, melissa, abby, mary) and go from there
i can extend to an hour
give me some thoughts on the 130 user testing and i can update.
thoughts?
updated to an hour
mary melissa robbie and abby are the only outsiders now.
sorry - was in a meeting
I think if we can get those 3 we'll be fine
which 3? listed 4 ha
Hey guys, should we have everyone be in the room at once or ask people to come in one-by-one so that no one is influenced by the perceptions of others?
<@U026E0ZNR> <@U0260V4K1> thoughts? one at a time is interesting
One at a time for sure
one at a time it is.
<!channel>: typing feedback from user testing will be in your after show and tell
nice - thank you
